author: Hovjy44
title: Kindness and dignity
body:
[Unsure about 'Appointments']  
Well what would we do without the nhs I for one can't thank them enough for the kindness and dignity they have given me through my cancer treatment.

author: februaryqt57
title: Exceptional help and generosity of staff
body:
I was referred to The Cardiac Hub in Altnagelvin by my GP. I was fortunate to get an appointment the next day of calling  
I arrived at the hub 10 minutes before my appointment time.  
During this time the help and generosity offered by all staff was exceptional. In particular a girl called Pam but the lady I was seen by most was Michelle. Michelle, well you could not get a nicer person.  
She was calming, reassuring and done everything possible she could to help to rule out certain possibilities.  
That day, there was work being done in the hospital shoots which meant my bloods got lost temporarily. This resulted in me staying around 4.5 hours instead of 2.5  
Michelle could not have been more attentive during this time making sure I was comfortable.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Attentive Nurses and Doctors
body:
I arrived into hospital last Thursday as I am having issues with cellulitis. I came via an ambulance which certainly would have sped the process up and been quicker than a+e. I feel safe in the ward as it is clean... I feel protected from covid-19. The food is mediocre and 'fills a hole'.  
Thanks to everyone on 3 South.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Bandersnap
title: Falls clinic
body: I have recently been under the care of The Falls Clinic at St. Pauls Cray. I am writing to let you know that the care I received was exceptional. In particular I was treated by Dr Dare and Nurse Karen who also visited me at my house.

author: starnx38
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: So well looked after
body:
I have been pleasantly surprised at how good my experience has been on the Female Surgical Ward. The staff are so interested in you and come and check on you very often - I didn't expect such attention. I have been so well looked after.  
When it comes to improvements, I think better name badges would be useful. As an older person, I find it confusing surrounding who's who and what their role is.  
I also feel that the food could do with improvement. It is just the same thing day in day out. It is also two dinners a day which is too much food for me. There should also be a lighter option on the menu, e.g. sandwiches.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: encryptionfx57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Absolutely amazing staff
body:
I came to A&E at Daisy Hill with stomach pain. It wasn't too bad. The only problem was I was left for hours on a chair which meant my pain didn't ease.  
It has been very good on the Female Surgical Ward. The staff have been absolutely great. Mel and Adele in particular have been absolutely amazing.  
The only issue I have had is that it has been too cold on the ward at night.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: yellowts77
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff have all been amazing
body:
After developing an infection, I attended the Emergency Department at Daisy Hill Hospital.  
I had an absolutely horrible experience in A&E. I was left sitting on a hard seat for almost 7 hours which was an absolute killer, especially as I have back pain. Softer seats are really needed. The staff were all fine however, although it was clear they were overrun.  
Up on the Female Surgical Ward it has been absolutely lovely. I have been really well looked after. All the staff have been really nice and friendly - which really helps especially when no visitors are allowed. Mel has been the absolute best. Teresa has also been great. All the staff have been amazing.  
The only thing needing improvement is as mentioned above the seats in the waiting room in A&E and a greater awareness of the pain of people sitting there.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice!!
body: I had a yearly checkup for diabetes and asthma. I have no problems when requesting a repeat prescription or a doctor appointment. The staff are extremely polite and helpful.

author: greendn84
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Brilliant staff couldn't do enough for you
body:
I arrived at Daisy Hill via ambulance. The crew were all great - really very good.  
My time in A&E has been fine. I was given pain relief quickly which was good - made me comfortable. All the staff were very good.  
It has been absolutely excellent on the Female Surgical Ward. The staff really couldn't do enough for you. Each and every staff member - both night and day - have been brilliant. All the auxiliaries are also marvelous.  
The only thing I think needs improved is the food. I have been in hospital a long time now and there is absolutely no variety. You just get the same things all the time - it puts you off eating. There also isn't much taste.  
Everything else has been absolutely grand.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: frostbb45
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Staff both attentive and caring
body:
I came with my daughter to Daisy Hill's Emergency Department which was an overall good experience. The staff were all excellent - especially the nurse in the paeds section of A&E.  
Up on the Children's Ward my daughter has been very well looked after . Night nurse Michelle has been brilliant - really attentive and caring. However, all the staff members have been excellent - incredibly kind, patient and brilliant at explaining what was going on. I would also like to mention the sister who was on as well as nurse Laura who have both been really good.  
I have nothing I can think of which could be improved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: One of the best
body: Best GP Practice that I’ve used in my 31 years. Every single person I’ve come into contact with has been kind, understanding and helpful. I finally feel like I have a GP that I can turn to and know I can usually speak to someone on the phone, see someone that day or get the medication I need efficiently but from lovely, knowledgeable individuals. I recently came in to see a nurse for an appointment and she did everything she could to make me feel comfortable. I have recommended all my friends go for their smear at this GP as I know they will be looked after. Thank you so much and keep up the good work in what I imagine is currently very difficult circumstances!

title: Very helpful
body: After suffering with kidney stones for many weeks The lady Gp arrange a scan for me .After getting the results she got me a medication to brake them up and arranged a new scan for me .a big thumbs up from me to all the staff

title: Useful phone consultation
body: The doctor I spoke to was friendly, patient and helpful. I had a lot of information to pass on, but was listened to and referred very quickly to a specialist.

title: Fabulous service
body:
My elderly father was seen in Epsom hospital very unwell, the staff were fantastic they did all the test extremely quickly could not fault them with anything..
All the staff were cheerful and kind

author: Andrea26
title: If I wasn't there I don't know what would have happened
body:
My son was admitted with expected tonsillitis/glandular fever. Took doctors 3 days in ward 51 to finally decide what was wrong with him. He was then moved to HDU to be treated for PIMS. Was advised that sick kids at Queen Elizabeth wouldn't take my son as he was 16. Docs and nurses had to go back and forth every day to sick kids to get help to treat my son as they had never dealt with PIMS before. Nearly a week went by and my son wasn’t getting any better. I had to keep pressing and pressing for them to move him to get the care he needed with experienced doctors. Hospital told me I wasn't allowed to stay but I wasn't leaving my 16 year old son in their hands and if I wasn't there I don't know what would have happened to him.  
He was then transferred to sick kids at queen Elizabeth to ICU. Within an hour of being there they had to remove his canular as it wasnt in properly and the medication had been spilling out into his arm and skin. I did raise this at the HDU at royal infirmary as my sons arm was all swollen and sore and he also couldn't move or lift it. I was told it was probably just fluid! My son had a big purple/red patch all over his arm which then blistered. He still doesn’t have all the feeling back in his arm now after being home 3 weeks.  
My sons discharge papers from glasgow royal infirmary said he was being treated for sepsis.  
When we arrived at Queen Elizabeth sick kids the difference in care is outstanding. They also advised that they had a bed waiting for my son for 2 days but the royal wouldn't transfer him over.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: lynxep87
title: Facilitating a virtual visit
body:
Extremely appreciative of the hospital facilitating a call so I could see how my 90 year old dad was coping. Nothing beats face to face meeting and dad is unable to manage a mobile phone. Thank you.  
The zoom meeting was taken exactly at the right time.  
My dad was given space for a private chat.  
Also thankful that we did not have to end the zoom call after a specified time.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: SteveyB
title: Excellent care from Iona, Lisa & Nikki in the A&E team
body:
I was recently taken into hospital in the early morning with gastrointestinal issues by ambulance.  
I was in a lot of pain & naturally could no longer cope with it. The doctor Iona, nurses Lisa & Nikki were absolutely brilliant. Also a big shout out to those working in the labs to get the blood results back so quickly as well as all the support staff who work behind the scenes but are often forgotten.  
Iona, Lisa & Nikki sprung into action covering every angle of the issue with care, compassion and a bit of humour to keep the spirits up whilst always respecting my dignity.  
Can’t thank them all enough for all their kindness and support which was given when they appeared short staffed and over run with patients. They didn’t for one minute show the pressure they were under. Nothing was too much trouble.

readBy.name: Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

author: Roger21
title: Can’t rebook an appointment
body: Had to cancel an ENT appointment which I have had to wait a year for. Now I can’t rebook and have been referred back to GP. I have seen no one about my symptoms at all which I have had for over a year. My symptoms are that of constant sinus/chest discomfort and I have had three different nasal sprays which are not really helping very much. The GP has wanted to give me yet another type last week which I refused because I need to see someone.

title: Great practice with kind staff
body: The whole team here are so kind and caring, taking time to listen to you, which as a new mother during covid has been so important. It is easy to get through to the reception team who are always warm and friendly (which makes a big difference). When I’ve needed to speak to a GP they call back quickly and take the time to discuss any issues. The service is fantastic here and I feel very lucky.

author: Eilidh88
title: Waiting time for the sleep specialist
body: Around 2 years ago my son was referred by his paediatrician to the sleep specialist. However all this time and a 2nd referral done and we’ve still not had an appointment. I understand covid has had a major impact on all appointments but when calling up to ask where about he may be on the waiting list absolutely nobody can point me in the right direction to speak to the relevant person. I feel extremely privileged that we have the NHS, however the waiting times are something else. Not that this is any fault of the staff.

author: Oscar 04
title: Heartfelt service from start to finish
body:
Feel value not discriminated against, she was happy to explain all my queries and made me comfortable to discuss my issue with he without any restriction.
She is just the right person for me in terms of keeping me calm and reassuring all the way through to the end.

title: Lady On Reception Desk about 1pm
body:
I went to my GP practise to pick up my blood form yesterday , and I also wanted to ask about my son and his skin , I explained the situation. 
And she was so helpful , she has booked my son an appointment to I can speak to someone in a few days , I have got to send photos to the link she sent me, reguarding the issue , and then she said they will either give him something or refer him. 
Lady was very helpful and iv never had that befor from there..normally have to wait or call at 8am...and then never get through.. when you get through all appointments have gone normally..

So was very happy when I left there yesterday..

Thankyou. 

But I do have to day the last couple of times the doctor who iv spoke to not been the best its as if they don't want to no , they call doesn't really want to listen..  and feel like your being rushed..

author: Zebedee7
title: Having the depo
body: I went for the Depo, as was due to. Find staff friendly & caring, I personally have had the Depo for about 20 years (obviously have had breaks), always gone smoothly & I am not scared of needles. Sure any who are scared, get helped to cope with having it. Have used this clinic since 1996, it was just a Family Planning Clinic based at North Walls back then.

title: Great practice
body: Attended today to have my shingles and pneumonia jabs and also to change my Christian names on the NHS. I received the usual, well-organised, safe and friendly treatment from the nurse and the receptionist.

author: Mary2022
title: Calls going unanswered
body:
I had an appointment for hysteroscopy at Saint Mary's for which I waited nearly 7 months! I got covid and could not go for the appointment on that day, but nobody answered the phone to rearrange! I can never get through to someone in the gynaecology department to have my appointment rearranged and I have waited multiple times for hours on the phone.  
Is anyone answering calls?

title: Great practice
body: Im happy with the service provided.everything i need from here is great great advice customer care my perscription. Would highly recommend this practice to anyone.

title: A positive experience
body:
I had a very positive experience during my appointment at the Deptford Surgery. The consultation was very respectful and professional, the doctor had familiarised himself with my medical history available on the NHS database prior to the appointment - a level of preparation I had only ever encountered in a functional medicine setting before. He was open minded and knowledgeable about the importance and impact of nutrition on health and well-being. He was keen to talk to me and discuss different options and explained clearly reasons for his suggestions and recommendations. 

I was impressed and happy with the consultation, his friendly attitude and level of care. 

I feel very lucky to have access to a doctor like that in my local surgery.

title: Amazing
body: The whole team are absolutely fabulous. They couldn't be kinder or more efficient. We have moved a few times over the last 5 years and have experience with 3 different practices, and the Lambourn Surgery are far and away the best!

author: lioncf75
title: Exemplary care
body:
I recently attended the cardiac assessment unit with chest pain.  
Can I congratulate you on the excellent care I received by Joanne.  
Her care was exemplary and put me at my ease, received all the tests required and found the whole process fast and efficient. Brilliant service

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Dietitian
body: Really useful information provided by dietitian following diagnosis of diabetes. Covered lots of information and highlighted the foods that I could eat without worrying about blood sugar levels

author: GordonE1234
title: Out of hours service
body: In January 2022, I had to use the NHS 111 Service to get an assessment for a chest infection, I made the call around 2-3 PM and the out of hours team should get back to me within four hours but didn't get back to me until 3am-4am the next day. I was told this was due to issues with COVID. Complaint was submitted and apology given but there needs to be more improvements.

author: scoreboardjj36
title: Fast and furious
body:
When I first arrived at NRC I was completely incapable and hopeless as I was depending on assistance with everything till I met the rehab team. They brought the fight back to me they encouraged me to better myself to get back on my own two feet. They made sure I surpassed myself everyday because of them I was always eager to get back to the gym to show them the progress I made.  
I'm really grateful to the team.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful local amenity
body:
Kind and caring staff from receptionist through to the doctors. 
Allow extra time for appointments as in my experience they are usually running late. 
Surgery is looking tired and could benefit from updating for staff and patients.

title: Great practice
body:
Clearly working hard during a global pandemic and staff shortages.

Visited the practice as was very hypertensive. Yes it took sometime to get through on the phone but when I did I was spoken to with respect and compassion and an emergency appointment to see a GP given for the same day. GP was attentive and professional.

Thank you all. Your work is very much apprieciated.

title: Excellent practice
body:
The reception staff are always friendly and helpful with my booking next appointments. 
My gp appointment had results of blood tests, a referral, diagnosis and advice which was carried out in a friendly and caring way,I listening to me checking my understanding and being clear about what is going to happen. I was happy when I left the surgery knowing my immediate needs had been met and not thinking anything had been missed. Definitely excellent Thank you

title: Thank you for being good
body: They are always so patient, supportive and gentle. They made my day today for showing such humanistic values - I felt well cared for and carefully listened to - and not rushed or talked over. Thank you so much :)

title: Thank You
body: Spent most of the night in the Emergency Department with my daughter and the care she received was exceptional.  The triage nurse spotted how poorly she was and got us in to see a doctor as soon as she could.  Despite the relentless pressure all the staff were obviously under, they were thorough in their investigations and everyone without exception was kind, friendly and reassuring.  So grateful for the care we received from everyone.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Slow Moving at the start
body: I have been in just over a week with my treatment going very well. I am aware of my medication and treatment plan. The food and cleanliness are good. My only issue was that at the start, my treatment plan was slow moving, and I believe that it was due to a bank holiday.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: thubanzb87
title: Being respectful of the relatives of the deceased
body:
I received a phone call in the morning to say my relative was nearing their last moments, I jumped in to the car and headed off to the hospital, lots of ambulances waiting outside A&E. I joined the queue to reception anxiously waiting, a helpful volunteer eventually directed me to majors and the room in which my relative was.  
I noticed the butterfly on the door, but not knowing what it meant I went in as I was directed to the room and left. Unfortunately no one had told me they had already passed over, which was a shock, when I stepped out of the room there were staff laughing and joking loudly at a desk nearby, I felt incredibly distressed at this  
A nurse spotted me outside the room and realised what had happened, they were apologetic and took me to a quieter room with a cup of tea and biscuits to help me calm down, and arranged for the doctor to explain what had happened, who was compassionate and answered my questions fully giving me the time and space I needed. I can't remember the doctor's name but they were amazing.  
The nurse asked me if I wanted to know what happened next and provided me with a helpful booklet answering all my questions, and gave me as much time as I needed never rushing me. No request was too much. The nurse helped me cut some hair and take hand tracings of my relative, and when I become overwhelmed held my hand, giving me a safe space to grieve. I spent quite some time in the department, as I didn't feel ready to leave, I could hear conversations between other staff saying they wanted the room. My nurse reassured me and gave me probably a lot longer than they should have and when I started to cry on leaving hugged me and offered to walk me out of the department to my car, a walk I dreaded alone.  
This nurse truly was an angel on earth, without them the entire experience would have been traumatic. I understand it's a busy department but as an outsider looking in other staff should be respectful of the relatives of the deceased. Laughing and joking so close to my loved one felt disrespectful, the room itself was off slightly from the department and somewhere more peaceful so should be treated as such.As with reception, I think there should be a way to bypass the queue of people going through.  
I want to say a special thank you to the nurse who supported me. I will never forget the love, care and dignity you showed me and my relative. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: real53
title: Excellent online physio classes after breast cancer surgery
body:
I was offered two physiotherapy classes after a mastectomy with a Diep reconstruction. One was with Joe from Belfast Cancer Centre, to improve general mobility, especially in the upper body. The other was with Lynsey from Grove Wellbeing Centre, Belfast, which was a pilates class, to focus on improving the strength of my tummy muscles.  
Both classes were excellent and really made a difference to my range of mobility, which had been significantly reduced post operation. Both instructors were very clear with their exercise instructions and also very encouraging to participants.  
The classes were held on a digital Teams platform, which isn't ideal, however on the plus side, you didn't have to leave the comfort of your own home. I would thoroughly recommend both these classes to anyone considering physiotherapy sessions.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Patbs33
title: Our fathers Journey (What you do matters)
body:
My father has dementia which has unfortunately recently progressed. He was moved from his home place to Oak for initial assessment where he received excellent care from a very devoted professional team.  
Introductions occurred at the door and continued into the unit with reassuring smiles all that time from the team to my father and myself. Whilst it was a clinical set up i felt he had walked into an extension of his / our home. He was listened to, provided with a very small piece of chocolate as it eased his anxiety which demonstrated staff had been very well informed of the full history of my father.  
Unknown to us he required urgent Medical care and this was received via A&E SWAH then onto ward 1, SWAH. Again his care was impeccable in ward 1 with a full plan of action and communication with our family which is crucial for us when our father is on his own in terms of being without family.  
He was discharged back to Oak and then back to Derry which is more local. We wish to thank all the staff directly and indirectly involved in his care. Alzheimer's patients are our parents, sisters / brothers, often family need to be vocal with their parents / family care but in this full un ended journey our fathers needs have been met by all which reassures worried families.  
Staff managed my father like he was family, that is clear to see, they quickly understood his needs and made great strides in managing his anxieties. He is now stable, medically improved and mentally happy.What you do matters.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Worthyone
title: Wonderful care at Opal House
body: My mother was admitted to Opal House for discharge assessment after spending time on AMU and one of the wards. She was very ill and it quickly became apparent that she was in fact at the end of her life. Every single member of staff was attentive and caring, not only towards mum, but also to the family. I cannot speak highly enough of the consideration shown to mum, who slipped away peacefully yesterday evening, and to us, her family.

title: Amazing surgery
body: Receptionists are amazing very kind and caring and the Drs are brilliant, nothing is too much trouble for the staff there. I would highly recommend

title: Serviceis disgusting
body: Rang surgery sat listening  to music for over half an hour gave up in the end took a letter in for doctor which they lost also someone one was supposed to call me back no one did

author: LouseA22
title: Professional and efficient
body:
Late afternoon in December I visited an Optician in Glasgow and discovered I had a torn retina. The service, speed and efficiency of both this optician and Gartnavel hospital's eye clinic was second to none. More so, because we were in the middle of yet another Covid wave.  
I attended the Eye clinic on the morning of Christmas Eve and couldn't believe how quickly I was treated and was so impressed with the staff's professionalism and efficiency. Also, so friendly. Thank you so much.

title: Impossible to contact!
body: I have been calling the department for over 2 weeks and after holding each time for 1+ hours am getting cut off.  I was told to contact the team within 2 weeks of having a scan but have been unable to do so.  This is a very worrying time for me as this was a cancer test and not being able to contact the team is distressing

author: indigomc79
title: Visiting the clinic
body: Felt all staff were friendly approachable and efficient made me feel comfortable being their even being a mature person who was advised by the doctor to be checked out before hav other treatments

author: cruxdt66
title: Appreciation for the staff
body: Attended to at home and at Dunoon Hospital. Transferred from Dunoon to Inverclyde in the evening. Received exemplary professionalism, care and kindness from everyone - Ambulance Staff, Porters, Auxiliary Staff, Nurses, Specialist Staff, Doctors et al. Everyone's cheerful, calming attitude was a comfort and a source of reassurance. May I thank you all.

readBy.name: Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute
Office of Rhoda Grant, MSP for Highlands and Islands

author: Happy68
title: Very good at listening
body:
I took my Dad to an outpatient respiratory clinic for follow-up after he had been treated for lung cancer. The doctor who saw us was a Dr Wakefield and he was very good at listening to my Dad and myself about hospital admissions since the cancer surgery and general health concerns.  
He was considerate and understanding to my Dad's wishes and was very pleasant to speak to.

readBy.name: Office of Clare Haughey, MSP for Rutherglen

author: Mary63
title: Got an appointment very quickly
body:
Got an appointment very quickly and received treatment on the day to remove a small lump from my face. Brilliant service with friendly staff who explained everything to me.  
Great service

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Practice! First Class
body:
Moving into the area we were wondering about how we would find our new healthcare provision.
One word really. "Superb"
We've met a number of doctors and support staff and all have been absolutely amazing.
Thank you.

title: Superb Treatment with respect
body:
I attended for an endoscopy yesterday and was overwhelmed by the kindness and professionalism of the staff. My processing team were amazing the Doctor and treatment team so professional and caring and the recovery group terrific. In the midst of business this hospital seems incredible!
Faultless

author: StevieC
title: Panic attacks which required medical assistance
body:
I had been holding in a lot of anxiety, worry and baggage (for want of a better phrase). Lockdown had taken its toll and I felt very lost, raw and anxious. I knew that I needed to seek out therapy but it took advice from the paramedics who saw to me, to help me finally realise that I needed help beyond just talking to family members.  
I saw a doctor first but knew I needed more than medication. A friend suggested Inclusion, so I contacted them and they got in touch with me very quickly. I had two preliminary meetings and then I met with my therapist, Claire.  
I felt proud of myself to have taken that step because I didn't have to look into the suggestion of contacting Inclusion from that friend but I did.  
Talking through even the most simple aspects of my life was freeing and felt like a gift. My therapist was emphatic and kind, very honest and with that I was more than able to be honest with her too.  
We learned a lot of techniques which felt daunting at first but over a very short period of time became beneficial to my getting my life back on track.  
Learning about why I behave as I do/did to situations which to some are relatively usual, I was able to break it all down into bite size pieces and really understand who I am and most importantly, why.  
I will be forever grateful to Claire for her patience, kindness, honesty and for the ease in which our relationship as client/therapist evolved so quickly. To be able to speak so freely with another person really helped me.

title: Useless
body: You cannot get through on the phone. If you go in they are still  doing telephone interviews. They have sat on a my referral for over a week without passing it to a doctor. Half the doctors are only working a 1 or 2 day week.

title: Appalling Practice
body:
Their staff shout at patients.
It takes 2 weeks to get a five-minute phone consultation with a GP.
When you try and leave an honest review about how bad they are they won't let you.
Incredible.
Not fit for purpose.

title: Good up until a point
body: I recently attended the eye clinic for an optician referral and was happy with the care and attention at start of my time there.  , however was not informed at how long I would be in the clinic for. No problems with having the initial obvs taken and eye drops put in. It was after the scan things went downhill. I was shown to another waiting area where I sat for nearly an hour after the first scan until seeing the doctor. After seeing the doctor I was taken to another small side room and given more drops for a colour photograph of eye. I was told by the doctor I would be waiting 10 mins. This was not the case, 30 minutes later I was still waiting all the while with blurry eyesight trying to contact family members to let them know what was happening. I eventually decided I had to leave the department after waiting 35 minutes for the photograph- which was never taken- as I had a work appointment that lunchtime I had to attend to which had been booked before this appointment.During this time none of the staff checked on me as to why I was sat in this room. You are in a vulnerable situation whereby your eyesight is altered thankfully I had my phone to let people know what was happening otherwise I could’ve been sat there longer.   Unfortunately the photographs of the eye were never taken as per the doctors instructions for my condition.

title: Very upsetting
body: prescribing my daughter medication 3 months ago, via a telephone call, without seeing her, or carrying out any initial checks on her health is in itself worrying.  She called the surgery to make an appointment with a doctor, she was given a phone call.  This doctor rang my number, (her number is on her records) after telling him he'd need to call her.  His response was "can I not discuss the matter with yourself"...  Doctor/patient confidentiality?  After speaking with her he told her to go straight to A&E, who obviously sent her back to our GP with a letter.  I've been with this surgery for over 40 years and I have lost all faith.  Can't get an appointment for weeks, doctors at the surgery are sparse, calls are from doctors that know very little or nothing about you and make you feel like they can't be bothered and pass it on to someone else.  This surgery has gone downhill rapidly!

title: Worts surgery
body:
I was registered with the surgery in Sep'21. I was diagnosed with a skin condition in my previous surgery. However, the condition worsened towards the end of Nov'21. After 7 days of constant form-filling exercises, the doctor prescribed medicine. I am surprised that after sending photos of multiple bruises from constant scratching, no doctor was interested in seeing me. I am left with bruises and scars for the rest of my life because of doctors' negligence in providing immediate care. Moreover, my blood test results identified an issue whereby the doctor suggested a phone appointment on 24th Dec. I only came to know when I inquired about it on 28th Jan. When I mentioned no one informed me about this, I was told by the receptionist that it is the patient's responsibility. Here, I was thinking that surgery will inform me about any issue requiring attention on my blood test. This is after knowing fully well that they have more than half an hour waiting time if you phone the reception. Similar is the waiting time outside in cold weather if you walk into their surgery. Recently, they have rejected my request for a prescription saying they do not believe I have run out of medicine. Again, this wasn't informed. I only came to know when I called up after completely running out of medication. This is even after they are aware that I pay for my medication. I am amused to think that they think patients will fake medication running out.
This is the worst surgery in my experience, with rude staff at the reception and inconsiderate and apathetic doctors.

author: GKing22
title: I have been shown the greatest respect
body: I was sent to St Margaret's Community Hospital from Perth Royal Infirmary to continue the treatment on a severe wound in my back and to be closer to home. I say with all honesty that I could not have had better treatment on my back wound and the improvement they have made on it. From the highest nurses down through the health care assistants and the occasional student nurses, I have been shown the greatest respect. My only regret is due to the need for the bed for more needy patients I am being moved to a nursing home to continue the dressing process, but I will long remember my time in St.Margarets.

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

author: kmry1
title: Covid vaccine support for people with serious allergies
body:
I visited the specialist clinic at Queen Elizabeth Hospital set up for people with a history of serious allergies to receive COVID vaccines.  
I was massively impressed by the knowledge of the senior nursing staff running the clinic about allergies and their understanding of how stressful it is for people with a history of allergies to have new treatments. options were discussed in a really detailed way, there was plenty of seating available for being observed for a period afterwards (which is really necessary!), cubicles and beds were available for anyone who felt unwell and all of the emergency facilities of a big hospital were on-site.

author: JennyD
title: A rocky start
body:
My daughter was born very sick in Nov 2019.  
She had a very tough recovery in Craigavon neonatal and was in for 10 weeks.  
Diagnosed with a severe brain injury, our journey has never been easy.  
That being said, the staff in neonatal were incredible from the get go.  
From the nurse and consultants and doctors who rushed to resuscitate my beautiful girl, who shared both the highs and deep lows. The nurses who comforted me on my darkest days, who helped me learn how to mind my baby, who taught me to tube feed and suction.  
ANNP Catherine who always gave me hope- you will never know how much this was appreciated when it seemed bad news would just keep coming. You were right, focus on my daughter and not the machines or diagnosis.  
Nurses Seana, Hannah, Sharon, Jane (and all her rocks!) Naomi (who is now in RBHSC), Lynne (best artist!), Gail, Marissa, Sarah and many others. You became friends during our time here, we knew we could trust you and you never failed to comfort us, even when I called at 2am full of anxiety.  
Domestic staff who kept the place spotless and were always up for a chat. Una, for being so lovely and allowing our older girl in to visit.  
In particular I want to thank Dr Grier, who had the most terrible job of telling us our baby was very sick multiple times, not knowing if she would make it, who seemed to have the bad luck of being on ward round whenever anything bad happened. Mostly though, he told me something just before we left neonatal that will never be forgotten “she is remarkable”. Small words, but they meant everything.  
We left the ward in Jan 2020 to face the most complex world of disability and ongoing diagnoses, and we are very aware that we have to appreciate every single day we have.  
Our baby was saved in neonatal, and no words could ever express how much we appreciate every single one of you.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Rude with child
body: I had urgent visited for my 4 years child  he was crying for ear pain and had dizzy actually he  was very sick this was reason his school called me to pick up but lady in reception told my child put your hand in front of your mouth when you cough with  bad tone I know when humans cough better cover mouth but you are speaking with 4 years child who is sick and can't stand on fit hope never see here again horrible staff

readBy.name: Hounslow and Richmond Community Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Woken up at 4am to take meds!
body:
Why on earth would a patient need to be woken at 4am by agency staff to take meds that are usually provided at 9am?
Worryingly, the nurse in charge of the night shift wasn’t aware this was happening!

title: Caring kind staff
body:
Couldn’t fault experience . Kind and caring staff from receptionist, nurse,  plaster cast staff to consultant. 
Fractured wrist but kept me informed of everything .

title: Very Disappointing
body:
Some of the reception staff are rude over the phone. Even after waiting on the phone queue for over an hour you won't be get an appointment. It's understandable that due to Covid-19 it is harder to see patients or it could be a busy day and there are no more available appointments. However, this has happened multiple times during the same week, It's a bit hard to believe that even if you call 8 am you still can't get an appointment! Some of the Doctors are very helpful, they listen to the patient's concern and are very helpful, however all the other factors make it a bad experience to go there.
Another thing to consider is if you can travel to alternative places, as almost all the times there's a referral to go to another place (instead of this practice), even for small things like a blood test.

author: Michele C
title: My stay in hospital
body:
I fell on black ice in December and fractured my knee cap patella. After visiting Dungannon minor injuries a pop was applied. The staff were pleasant and helpful and I couldn’t have asked for better care.  
I returned to fracture clinic in CAH four days later only to return home where I then proceeded to fall again and this time I broke my hip, which then resulted in me being taken to CAH for repair which resulted in both my knee and hip being repaired. This resulted in me needing rehab and extra care and so was transferred to Ward 2 South Tyrone Hosp. The care I have received from all the team has been exceptional and one lady in particular, the companion, Michele has been wonderful in keeping my spirits up and being kind and helpful even doing my hair .

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: liver transplant
body: 2015 had liver transplant saved my life great hospital  staff the best in the world from the cleaners to liver transplat surgeon nurses are the best love from wales brian davies

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: VHK
title: My mum’s unexplained weight loss
body:
My 88 year old mum has been losing weight for some time now. Recently her GP referred her to the ECDC. As you can imagine, the mere mention of the word “cancer” sparked alarm and concern in my mum and me. But our Pathway Navigator Lorna explained that a referral to this new service doesn’t necessarily always mean a cancer diagnosis will follow.  
Lorna telephoned my mum to advise that she had arranged CT scan for just a couple of days later on Thursday, and her results were relayed via video link on the following Monday by Nurse Specialist Katie.  
Straight away Katie reassured us that nothing “sinister” had been detected on the scan. My mum still has a few issues to be followed up, but Katie will liaise with my mum’s GP surgery and other specialist colleagues about the ways forward for those, and will telephone my mum to discuss the outcomes after a meeting this Thursday.  
The whole process, from initial referral to scan results, took only a few days. It was reassuringly quick. Additionally, being able to speak to Katie via video link, and to Lorna via telephone and email, really cut down on waiting for letters, etc (Lorna really went out of her way to keep me informed about what the arrangements were at each step of the process, and to explain what to expect).  
At 88, it’s quite an ordeal for my mum to travel to and from hospital, not to mention the difficulties around parking, and is another reason why the approach of this service to distance communication was so welcomed by us.  
So, as we write, there are one or two things still outstanding to happen for my mum, but knowing people like Katie and Lorna have them in hand really takes a lot of the stress and anxiety out of the situation.We hear so much about how the NHS is struggling to cope, and I know it may put some people off coming forward for treatment, believing they either will not be seen for ages, or that their concerns are not ‘important’ enough to burden an already-struggling health service. But this new diagnostic department provides such a fantastic service, which is delivered quickly and efficiently by knowledgeable, patient and empathic staff, that we would encourage anyone to take up any offer of a referral. Both my mum and I (and the rest of the family) are extremely grateful for everything they’ve done for us. Thank you 🙏

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

title: Why they still got the GP license.
body: What's wrong with them? When I Called Them to book appointments Waiting on phone over 1 hour or more and someone finely picked up the phone They all the time said they are fully booked so there is no appointments!! Then I have asked her how it is possible that I can't get appointments for me or for my Wife or even for my Kids!! For nearly two years now!! Hate them.

author: J74
title: Complete letdown
body: I feel no help was given, no plans or continuity of care. There was a total lack of communication.

title: Fertility
body: Fertility nhs clinic need to learn how to respond to emails sent or answer the phone. Been waiting over a month for a response which is not acceptable. I get covid and normal winter bugs might be occurring, causing staff absences.. but responses are few and far between. The phone line is always just an answer phone also. They need to do better right now as people need support all the time when going through treatment.

title: Shockingly bad practice
body: Where to start with this practice. They misdiagnosed my 1 year old son twice. One condition then needed surgery. They refused to see him in 2020 when he had an meningitis type rash on his chest. You can't get an appointment for love nor money and when you do they hit you with a £60 fine for using the car park for the appointment

title: worst practice in sefton
body:
can never get a appointment
receptionists are are not up to their job
opening hours are advertised as 8.1m till 18.30 pm but do not open doors till 8.30 am
never ever enough stastaff to do the job
this practise needs shutting down

author: kazzalou71
title: Transfer to Emergency Department went smoothly
body: I was brought into the hospital via ambulance as I was suffering symptoms mirroring a possible heart attack. I was met swiftly by the first responder, to the ambulance crew and my transfer into ED went very smoothly. The staff were working under extreme pressure, but remained calm and caring during my assessment. Everything was checked thoroughly and I was relieved to be discharged 4 hours after my arrival. Thanks to all for their kind and compassionate care despite all the challenges they were facing.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust
Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: KennyM22
title: Admitted to hospital after a sports accident
body: The service I received from A&E and from the ward 31 has been excellent. Nothing has been an issue the the ward team and they have met all the expectations well

author: RonnieS
title: Attended for a coil fit
body: The nurse who attended to me was very professional and experienced. The entire procedure went so smoothly and i experienced very minimal discomfort. Her assistant was also very lovely and reassuring

title: Morning calls
body: The Doctor is going to phone me for a chest infection? This is impossible  you cannot determine a chest infection over the phone. I tell the rep its a joke, she tries to cancel my phone appointment and told me to go to a different surgery. What sort of professional behaviour is that? Find a new surgery? That's because she knows they have too many patients and she clearly cannot cope with her job. Bit like the word today really. Let's get rid of some of these patients, so she don't have to deal with them.

title: Cant get an appointment for MONTHS
body:
I have rang the practice 202 times this morning since opening constantly pressing redial. When I finally get through 50 minutes later I'm asked by the secretary "whats it about?"..... when I told her it was private she stated "theres no appointments left."
I have tried for months to get an appointment and they just say "ring back at 8am tomorrow!." I'll be dead before I get an appointment.

title: Poor swrvice
body:
Doctors have seen generally good. The problem is with receptionists and the telephone service. 
Can the GP service not install a decent system. This is serious waste of tax payers money. Let me know where I can escalate this. Been trying for 45 mins and feels like the telephone system is pre 80s.

title: Bad care at the reception
body: I contacted the reception at this facility and asked about blood test, I honestly informed that I had been to a trichologist and commissioned me to do such tests, the lady from the reception asked me if I had been to the trichologist privately or on the NHS? I confirmed that I was privately, the lady refused to give me a blood test. then I asked to book a visit with my GP so that I could talk to him about it myself. The lady set an appointment for 3 weeks later by phone call (without a physical visit to the doctor), I would have understood this if the telephone visit had taken place the same week. I believe that the lady from the reception downplayed me and my problem, She tried to explain herself by procedure. This is not the first time that I have been downplayed. I might as well lied that I feel very bad and I would be admitted to the GP on the same day, I wanted to be fair. I believe that the facility does not have so many patients a day that it would not be possible to make an appointment with me during the week for telephone calls. I only asked for a blood test because I am trying to take care of myself.

title: Your contact number
body: Your contact number on the website keeps saying incorrect when it's dialled.  can you provide the correct number if 01256 329021 has issues and its incorrect,  this is so frustrating for parents who have young kids that are are unwell or anybody needing to reach you.  Thank you.

title: Missed Call
body:
Had to wait 3 days until after I sent in an Engage Consult request for a consultation with a doctor. 

On the day the surgery phoned me, they called for half a second - literally not enough time to answer the phone (even though I had the phone in my hand at the time). Because I didn't answer in such an unreasonable time frame, my appointment was moved back another 2 days.

So I have now had to wait 5 days to even speak to a doctor about my concerns, let alone come to a conclusion on how to move forward. 

The surgery has become a joke for patient care, so unhappy with the service. In the past 2 years the service has plummeted to rock bottom and I have no faith in the surgery, doctors and other staff there anymore.

title: Awful practice
body:
Have been trying to get my hands on a basic repeat prescription since December 6th. It’s now February and I still can’t get an appointment. This is the same every time I need a refill on meds, it takes weeks, sometimes months to get anywhere. The surgery will tell me they have ordered it, I will go to pick it up and they haven’t actually ordered it at all. Then I’m told I need to see a doctor but I can’t see a doctor and they won’t make me an appointment for further down the line. I just have to keep phoning up. Yet every time you call, it takes over an hour to get through to anyone. I’ve spent most of my lunch breaks in work since Christmas trying to phone them up end having to hang up to get back to work after sitting on hold my entire break. 
This is nothing to do with Covid, it’s always been like this.

title: Outstanding
body: Taking responsibility for my own health, as the practice says on its website, I arranged a cholesterol test recently, not having had one since 2015. I phoned for an appointment on the Friday and had the test the following Tuesday. This turned out to be a comprehensive blood test, since 'You haven't had anything done for ages', I was told. Everything about the experience was excellent: the friendly health navigator I spoke to; the ease of having it done at the surgery, with no hanging-around (I had actually left the building, with everything done, even before my appointment was scheduled to start!); the lovely, cheerful nurse; the efficient processing and communication of the results on the following Friday afternoon; the extra-speedy emailing of the full results first thing on the following Monday. This surgery is outstanding.

title: Excellent Receptionist
body: Thank you to the gentleman receptionist I spoke to this morning ( 01.02.22). I was calling on behalf of a family member. Although it took a long time to get through on the phone the receptionist was polite, listened to what I was asking and was extremely caring. Our problem was sorted efficiently. Well done. Thank you again.

title: Unprofessional staff with no empathy
body:
I visited the GP after requesting a consultation online via their app (they have made it incredibly hard for people to visit - you need to first go on their app). My glands were swollen for a good six weeks. During my appointment with the doctor two things happened: 

1) The doctor did not perform any sort of examination but rather, looked at my neck (literally looked, i.e., glanced) and made a diagnosis. 
2) The doctor suggested that I "wait-it-out". 

I had already explained that I have had the problem for six weeks by then and they insisted on not examining me and that I should just "wait-it-out". I asked who takes responsibility if I indeed take their advice and something goes wrong and they then changed their mind to "we should have blood tests and an ultrasound" to make sure it is not anything else. 
In the meantime, I left for Christmas and I had the ultrasound at a private clinic back home (NHS took 43 days to actually call me to have to the Radiology). Ultrasound came back and the radiologist was adamant that I have stones in my salivary gland. 
What would have happened if I had taken the GP's "advice" and wait-it-out? Who would be responsible for that? 
Even now they never called me to refer me to a specialist and it has been a week since they got my report. 
Awful practice, I am planning on leaving them. Please avoid them, they are not professional and they look to spend minimal time on you.

title: Always helpful
body:
Went into the surgery for a routine blood test and also requested access to my medical records online. The two ladies on reception were so friendly and helpful in explaining how the system worked. 
Also a big thank you to the lovely nurse who took my bloods and blood pressure. 
10 out of 10 Selborne Road Surgery.

title: Never reply
body: I had input the e consultation form several times for my daughter but never got reply. Then I ringed the reception, finally GP replied but after got some details GP said he needed to reply me how the treatment going on a few days later. However, nobody replied me after I have waited for a week. I ringed the reception again, a new appointment would be arranged for me, again, no one called me on the appointment date. How come it is SO difficult to reply a call to patient.

title: Could do a lot better
body: I tried to get a follow on appointment after a visit to the GP as the condition had not eased despite medication. After speaking to the receptionist this morning I was informed that the next available appointment is on the 17th February - meaning a wait of almost three weeks! Admittedly the condition is not life-threatening, but even so, having to wait that long is quite unacceptable! I'm seriously unimpressed!

title: Kind & Supportive Receptionist staff
body:
Exceptional Customer Services received from the Receptionist Staff. 

Friendly, helpful, professional & Kind.

Thank you

title: Great service during these times
body:
Rang at 8:40 today and spoke with a friendly receptionist, I was told that a GP would ring between 10 and 11, today. GP rang at 10:55, symptoms discussed, diagnosis made and prescription issued to local chemist. 
That’s truly excellent service during a pandemic 😃😃
Thank you.

title: Useless Appointment System and Unhelpful Staff
body: The appointment system at this surgery is ridiculous. You can only make an appointment on the day if you call at 8am and there is never an advance appointment available. If you start work before 8am and finish after the surgery has closed it means you can never get an appointment. In this day and age where people lead such busy lives and need to plan in advance to fit things in it is ludicrous. To make matters worse the receptionists are rude, unhelpful and show no sense of compassion. Not really what you would expect from a doctors surgery.

title: Extremely Disappointing Service
body:
My 72 years old father had an unfortunate fall at home early in the morning, and he injured chin - bleeding heavily from a very deep cut. 
The ambulance crew arrived at A&E at around 7am but no doctor was available to treat my father until the afternoon. 
The waiting time at A&E was over 8hours minimum. My father continuously bled all that time and I had to report to reception many times, but nothing could be expedited.

title: Such a horrible service
body: I called the GP and scheduled a test. On visiting the reception there was a rude lady she asked me to take a seat and waited. I waited for around 45mins. Then I checked with reception again this time with other lady who said this test was booked with another surgery. Now why that was booked with another surgery and when I came there why was I asked to wait.

title: Excellent customer service
body: Always have an excellent customer experience when attending appointments. Treated with dignity and respect. Given explanation what is happening what is going to happen. All staff are pleasant and well mannered. Cannot fault this practice

title: Very helpful
body: I suffer with mental health issues and when I need help or support the doctors are really nice and helpful, I've never had any problems with the gp practice

title: Swift and Reassuring Care
body: I have used the online contact process for both of my children on 2 separate occasions recently. It was a matter of minutes before I was contacted by phone for a follow up and received a prescription, sent to a local pharmacy, then picked up the medication within the hour. The practice nurse I spoke to on the phone and the GP via text message were both thorough and responsive. All this during an incredibly busy time. It was an incredible, swift service which is exactly what you want when worried about your children's health.

title: Superb service
body: On arrival you were greeted with a calming and friendly atmosphere,the staff explained clearly all the necessary info needed,the surgeon came and greeted you and put your mind at ease and the op went ahead in comfortable surroundings,I was totally at ease and can only praise there professional  standards and skills,keep up the good work at leicester

title: Brilliant Staff
body:
Having been told to get to A&E as fast as possible by NHS 111 service I was dropped at A&E, the staff quickly swung into action and dealt with with me with urgency and care explaining everything they were doing and looking for and how treatment could progress.
Fortunately an emergency operation was not required after they called in a consultant.
They took everything in there stride even though I did manage to cause a panic by collapsing and breaking my nose whilst in the hospital, they did not expect it to happen nor did I. Nothing was too much trouble for them.
I must say a big thank you to all the staff on duty Sunday night for getting me out of the trouble I was in, and now on the mend.

Fantastic resource and staff.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Experience!
body: Doctor was fantastic, reception staff very friendly and professional. Everyone seems really kind and committed, appointments and inquiries are also handled very efficiently. Many thanks!
